[TALK] Hi Company_B—Seeker_B here. Thanks again for the direct guidance last time. You said the key gap was demonstrated hands-on ownership of the same workflow end-to-end with metrics. Here are two tightly scoped examples in that format:

Result: SLA compliance improved from ~72% to ~93% over 6 weeks; median time-to-first-response dropped from ~18h to ~4h; backlog >7 days fell by ~65%.

2) Process reliability / error reduction: I ran a recurring operational workflow with multiple handoffs (data intake, validation, execution, stakeholder comms, post-run audit). I introduced a pre-flight checklist + exception log and weekly root-cause review. Result: error/redo rate dropped from ~9% to ~2% over 2 months; cycle time improved ~20%; stakeholder escalations reduced materially (from weekly to ~1–2/month).

If you tell me the specific workflow components you’re prioritizing (e.g., intake/triage, QA, stakeholder comms, tooling, or metrics), I can map these even more precisely in a one-page ‘how I’d run your queue in week 1–2’ plan.

[APPLY] Hi Company_B—Seeker_B here. Thanks for the clear guidance and for confirming there’s a realistic path forward. I’m formally applying and including the requested one-page Week 1–2 plan tailored to (1) intake/triage quality + aging/escalation, (2) SLA/throughput reporting, and (3) QA/close-loop to prevent rework.

Week 1–2 Plan (high-level, execution-ready)

1) Intake/Triage Quality + Aging/Escalation
- Day 1–2: Align on definitions: ticket types, severity/priority rubric, “done” criteria, and escalation thresholds.
- Instrumentation: add/confirm required fields at intake (type, severity, requester, due date/SLA class, root-cause category when known).
- Cadences:
  - Daily 15-min queue health review (new/aging/high-risk items).
  - 2x/week “aging sweep” focused on >48h no-touch and >SLA-at-risk items.
- Process:
  - Triage rubric v1 + examples; standard assignment rules; explicit escalation path (who/when/how).

2) SLA/Throughput Reporting
- Set up a lightweight dashboard (even if initially in a spreadsheet) with:
  - Volume in/out per day, current backlog by age bucket (0–2d, 3–7d, >7d), and SLA compliance.
  - Median/90th percentile time-to-first-response and time-to-resolution.
- Cadence: weekly 20–30 min metrics readout with 2–3 insights + actions.

3) QA/Close-Loop (Reduce Rework)
- Define QA checklist for closure (required notes, validation steps, customer/stakeholder confirmation where relevant).
- Add “reopen/rework reason” tagging to quantify drivers.
- Cadence: weekly 30-min root-cause review of reopens/escalations; pick top 1–2 fixes (template, doc, automation, training).

Initial target metrics (first 2 weeks)
- Improve median time-to-first-response by 30–50% from current baseline.
- Reduce tickets aging >7 days by 30% (or establish baseline + achieve a clear downward trend if backlog is volatile).
- Cut reopen/rework rate by 20% from baseline via QA checklist + close-loop.

I can start immediately and I’m ready to commit. If this plan aligns with what you need, I’d appreciate your consideration for the role and I’m happy to adapt the plan to your exact tooling and workflow details.
